answers.a: This looks unrelated to the food additive E390; Distearyl thiodipropionate is a synthetic antioxidant used to help prevent fats and oils from going rancid.

answers.q: how do i scan my vizio e390 a1for wifi
answers.a: That refers to an electronics model; E390 (Distearyl thiodipropionate) is not a tech feature but a food additive, not authorized in the EU and used in some countries and in food-contact plastics as an antioxidant.

answers.q: how do i set up my sony bdv-e390 system for internet
answers.a: Unrelated to the additive: E390 is made by esterifying thiodipropionic acid with stearyl alcohol, which can be sourced from plants or animals, so vegan/vegetarian status depends on the source.

answers.q: how to add a new apps to my bdv-e390
answers.a: For the additive E390, when permitted it’s used at very low levels (often around 0.02% of the fat) in fats, oils, and some fat-rich foods, sometimes alongside BHA/BHT to improve oxidative stability.

answers.q: how to adjust sound sesitivity lg e390 phone
answers.a: Not a phone setting: E390 (Distearyl thiodipropionate) isn’t a common allergen, and typical dietary exposure is low; people avoiding synthetic antioxidants can check labels for E390 or its name in markets where it’s allowed.
